Line 25: Line 25:
The '''Delaware Department of Transportation''' ('''DelDOT''') is an agency of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Delaware]]. The current Secretary of Transportation is [[Cleon Cauley]].<ref>http://www.deldot.gov/home/secretary/ DelDOT Secretary, DelDOT website accessed 2 March 2009</ref> The agency has its headquarters in [[Dover, Delaware|Dover]].<ref>"[http://www.deldot.gov/home/contact_info/facilities.shtml Contact Information]." Delaware Department of Transportation. Retrieved on October 25, 2009.</ref>
The '''Delaware Department of Transportation''' ('''DelDOT''') is an agency of the [[U.S. state]] of [[Delaware]]. The current Secretary of Transportation is [[Cleon Cauley]].<ref>http://www.deldot.gov/home/secretary/ DelDOT Secretary, DelDOT website accessed 2 March 2009</ref> The agency has its headquarters in [[Dover, Delaware|Dover]].<ref>"[http://www.deldot.gov/home/contact_info/facilities.shtml Contact Information]." Delaware Department of Transportation. Retrieved on October 25, 2009.</ref>
  +   +
Since 2005, a major function of the Delaware Dept. of Transportation has been to remove basketball hoops from Delaware homes in order to prevent the noise pollution caused by playing children. This policy has met with some controversy. [http://content.usatoday.com/communities/gameon/post/2011/03/march-sadness-cops-tear-down-family-basketball-hoops-deldot/1]
The department's responsibilities include maintaining about 90 percent of the state's public roadways, overseeing the "Adopt-A-Highway" program, snow removal, the Division of Motor Vehicles and the Delaware Transit Corporation (known as [[DART First State]]).
The department's responsibilities include maintaining about 90 percent of the state's public roadways, overseeing the "Adopt-A-Highway" program, snow removal, the Division of Motor Vehicles and the Delaware Transit Corporation (known as [[DART First State]]).
